snippet: Microsoft owned up on Monday to the collapse of its biggest push into digital advertising, report Quentin Hardy and Michael J. de la Merced in Tuesday's New York Times. The company announced that it would take a $6.2 billion accounting charge in its...
abstract: Microsoft owned up on Monday to the collapse of its biggest push into digital advertising, report Quentin Hardy and Michael J. de la Merced in Tuesday's New York Times. The company announced that it would take a $6.2 billion accounting charge in its online services division -- essentially a write-off of the value of aQuantive, a digital advertising company that Microsoft bought in 2007.

headline.main: Daily Report: Microsoft's Foray Into Online Ads Goes Sour
